Milt,
It might be Mito work, but it could have been made elsewhere as well.  The upside down Fuji-san on the back is probably a reflection in a lake.  There are several lakes that are famous scenic spots for viewing Mt. Fuji this way.  A Google image search on "fuji kawaguchi ko" yields:

  http://www.yk.rim.or.jp/~tabata/fuji/e_fuji506317.html

and here's a view from Yamanaka-ko:

http://www.yk.rim.or.jp/~tabata/fuji/e_fuji506109.html

for example.

Jim



  http://cgi.ebay.com/ws/eBayISAPI.dll?
  ViewItem&item=2253732046&ssPageName=STRK:MEWN:IT


  opinion as to school of tsuba ?
  Also, look at third pic, isn't Mount Fuji upside down ?

  milt
